SEARCH
Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.backend

Class DenseFieldTensorBase<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,U extends SparseTensorMixin<T,U>,V extends Field<V>>

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.arrays.backend_new.AbstractTensor<T,Field<V>[],V>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverSemiRing<T,T,Field<V>[],V>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverRing<T,T,Field<V>[],V>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverField<T,T,Field<V>[],V>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.FieldTensorBase<T,T,V>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of this dense field tensor.
U - Type of sparse tensor equivalent to T. This type parameter is required because some operations (e.g. DenseTensorMixin.toCoo()) may result in a sparse tensor.
V - The type of the field which this tensor's entries belong to.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, DenseTensorMixin<T,U>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<T,T>, TensorMixin<T,Field<V>[],V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CTensor, CTensor64, FieldTensor
public abstract class DenseFieldTensorBase<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,U extends SparseTensorMixin<T,U>,V extends Field<V>> extends FieldTensorBase<T,T,V> implements DenseTensorMixin<T,U>

The base class for all dense Field tensors.

Then AbstractTensor.entries of a DenseFieldTensor are mutable but the AbstractTensor.shape is fixed.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • DenseFieldTensorBase

      protected DenseFieldTensorBase(Shape shape, Field<V>[] entries)
      Creates a tensor with the specified entries and shape.
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.
      entries - Entries of this tensor. If this tensor is dense, this specifies all entries within the tensor. If this tensor is sparse, this specifies only the non-zero entries of the tensor.

    • H

      public T H(int axis1, int axis2)
      Computes the conjugate transpose of a tensor by conjugating and exchanging axis1 and axis2.
      Specified by:
      H in class TensorOverRing<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,Field<V extends Field<V>>[],V extends Field<V>>
      Parameters:
      axis1 - First axis to exchange and conjugate.
      axis2 - Second axis to exchange and conjugate.
      Returns:
      The conjugate transpose of this tensor according to the specified axes.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either axis1 or axis2 are out of bounds for the rank of this tensor.
      See Also:
      • FieldTensorBase.H()
      • H(int...)

    • H

      public T H(int... axes)
      Computes the conjugate transpose of this tensor. That is, conjugates and permutes the axes of this tensor so that it matches the permutation specified by axes.
      Specified by:
      H in class TensorOverRing<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,Field<V extends Field<V>>[],V extends Field<V>>
      Parameters:
      axes - Permutation of tensor axis. If the tensor has rank N, then this must be an array of length N which is a permutation of {0, 1, 2, ..., N-1}.
      Returns:
      The conjugate transpose of this tensor with its axes permuted by the axes array.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any element of axes is out of bounds for the rank of this tensor.
      IllegalArgumentException - If axes is not a permutation of {1, 2, 3, ... N-1}.
      See Also:
      • H(int, int)
      • FieldTensorBase.H()

    • tensorDot

      public T tensorDot(T src2, int[] aAxes, int[] bAxes)
      Computes the tensor contraction of this tensor with a specified tensor over the specified set of axes. That is, computes the sum of products between the two tensors along the specified set of axes.
      Specified by:
      tensorDot in class TensorOverSemiRing<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,Field<V extends Field<V>>[],V extends Field<V>>
      Parameters:
      src2 - TensorOld to contract with this tensor.
      aAxes - Axes along which to compute products for this tensor.
      bAxes - Axes along which to compute products for src2 tensor.
      Returns:
      The tensor dot product over the specified axes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the two tensors shapes do not match along the specified axes pairwise in aAxes and bAxes.
      IllegalArgumentException - If aAxes and bAxes do not match in length, or if any of the axes are out of bounds for the corresponding tensor.

      public T T(int... axes)
      Computes the transpose of this tensor. That is, permutes the axes of this tensor so that it matches the permutation specified by axes.
      Specified by:
      T in interface TensorMixin<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,U extends SparseTensorMixin<T,U>,V extends Field<V>>
      Parameters:
      axes - Permutation of tensor axis. If the tensor has rank N, then this must be an array of length N which is a permutation of {0, 1, 2, ..., N-1}.
      Returns:
      The transpose of this tensor with its axes permuted by the axes array.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any element of axes is out of bounds for the rank of this tensor.
      IllegalArgumentException - If axes is not a permutation of {1, 2, 3, ... N-1}.

    • allClose

      public boolean allClose(T b, double relTol, double absTol)
      Checks if all entries of this matrix are close to the entries of b.
      Specified by:
      allClose in interface DenseTensorMixin<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,U extends SparseTensorMixin<T,U>>
      Parameters:
      b - Matrix to compare this tensor to.
      relTol - Relative tolerance.
      absTol - Absolute tolerance.
      Returns:
      True if b is the same shape as this matrix and all entries are 'close', i.e. elements x and y at the same positions in the two matrices respectively satisfy |ax-y| <= (atol + rtol*|y|). Otherwise, returns false.
      See Also:
      • DenseTensorMixin.allClose(DenseTensorMixin)

    • set

      public T set(V value, int... indices)
      Sets the element of this tensor at the specified indices.
      Specified by:
      set in class AbstractTensor<T extends DenseFieldTensorBase<T,U,V>,Field<V extends Field<V>>[],V extends Field<V>>
      Parameters:
      value - New value to set the specified index of this tensor to.
      indices - Indices of the element to set.
      Returns:
      If this tensor is dense, a reference to this tensor is returned. If this tensor is sparse, a copy of this tensor with the updated value is returned.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If indices is not within the bounds of this tensor.
